bibl.title: Territory of Washington vs. George Smith
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court for the Fourth Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: WARRANT Territory of Washington County of Spokane. TO THE SHERIFF OR ANY CONSTABLE OF SAID COUNTY: WHEREAS, Charles D. Colwell has this day complained in writing, under oath, to the undersigned, one of the Justices of the Peace in and for said county, that on the 1st day of June 1888. in said County and Territory, that John Doe did unlawfully feloniously steal, take and carry away one valise and its contents of the value of seventy five dollars, property of and belonging to the said Charles D. Colwell THEREFORE, In the name of the United States, you are commanded forthwith to apprehend the said John Doe and bring him before me to be dealt with according to law. Given under my hand this 2nd day of June, 1888
J.R. Snyder Justice of the Peace

Territory of Washington County of Spokane I hereby certify that I have issued this written warrant on this the 2nd day of June 1888 and arrested the written named defendant in the city of Spokane Falls Date this the 2nd day of June 1888
FEES. Serving Warrant $1.00 Mileage 20 Attendance 3.00 one day 1.00 Committing to jail 1.00

I, J.F. Warren being duly sworn, on oath depose and say that I have performed the services certified above. J.F. Warren Chief of Police Sworn and subscribed to before me this 2nd day of June 1888 J.R. Snyder Justice of Peace.
Territory of Washington vs. George Smith WARRANT. Filed June 2nd, 1888
J.R. Snyder Justice of the Peace
